Research Ethics

Week 3 - Research Ethics: Conducting research with human subjects creates an imbalance of power. In many ways, ethics help us manage and make sense of the appropriate, fair, and just use of that power to gain new knowledge. In this week we will investigate forms of normative ethics as well as their practical implementation in institutional review boards.

Readings

LIS Research Spotlight

  • Subramaniam, M. (2016). Designing the library of the future for and with teens: Librarians as the “connector” in connected learning. The Journal of Research on Libraries and Young Adults, 7(2), 1-18. PDF (Think about the source of data in this article)

Suggested

  • Williams, S (2016) All Labor is Local. Keynote at DLF Forum Video or Transcript

  • Scmhinckle. (2020, April 2). Why Disadvantaged Populations are at Greater Health Risk from COVID-19 – and How Libraries are Helping, Despite Closing Webpage
